linesOfText.text: This book is dedicated to my children,
DJ, Trinity, Alexis, and Chance.
Love, Dad
Dennis the wild bull was different
His horns were all twisty you see
He put rings in his snout
So that he would stand out
And dyed his tufts red as can be
Yes, Dennis was proud to be different
And glad in his heart to be free
For life's secret he knew
Was to like being you
And he liked being he... differently
He was taller and stronger and faster
Than farm bulls are usually
For he'd lived in the wild
Since a little bull child
On a great open range happily
Now Dennis lived here with his children
And he loved them with all of his might
They would run and they'd munch
On the sweet grass for lunch
And then chase the great sun into night
But one day the strangest thing happened
His whole world was taken away
Men shot darts from a jeep
That put Dennis to sleep
He woke up in a pen full of hay
Two bulls standing nearby seemed friendly
One was plump, one looked skinny and worn
"Feel better Amigo?
He's Benny, I'm Pedro.
What's up with your red tufts and horns?"
"Long story," snorted Dennis, "Where am I?"
Benny snickered, "You really don't know?
You're in show business dude."
Pedro sighed, "Benny's rude.
You're a bull in The Grand Rodeo!"
Dennis roared and he butted the fence-post
"My children are out there alone!"
Pedro begged, "Please calm down
Or the rodeo clowns
Will chain you! You'll never get home."
"Thanks Pedro, I owe you," said Dennis
"Freaking out fixes nothing, I know.
So I'm gonna stay cool
And play by their rules.
I'll even give them a really great show!"
So he wrapped a long string of bright feathers
'Round his horns and then jumped up and down
The top cowboy spied him
And yelled, "I must ride him!
That wild one there pawing the ground!"
Swipe to continue...
But Dennis ran to the arena
Feathers flying, he raced 'round the ring
No cowboy astride him
Could hang on and ride him
And the crowd cheered him doing his thing
Dennis that night tasted stardom
But next morning his friends found him tense
"Being different you see
Is about being free!
So I'm going to break down that fence!"
"You can't do that alone," Pedro warned him
"You are right, Pedro, I need a team.
So you're bustin' out too.
Does that sound good to you?"
Pedro gasped, "Being free is my dream!"
"But," Benny explained, "Me and Pedro
Have lived in this show since we're three.
We have no place to go."
Dennis smiled, "You're wrong Bro,
I'm taking you both home with me!"
"You've got a big heart," Benny told him.
"And we like how you're different and strange."
So they broke that fence down
And galloped out through the town
Heading west with the sun toward the range.
Now Dennis, his kids, and two buddies
Live freely and they are a sight.
As they run and they munch
On the sweet grass for lunch
And then chase the great sun into night
